result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul Olivas III

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Paul Olivas III in court.  Attorney Eric m Hailstock Mr in court for Paul Olivas III.  Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel's first appearance, adjourned for discovery and pretrial. 
Hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Per WCSD, def is no longer in custody and should report on his own for the hearing on 10-12-22.

Not possess/use any controlled substance without valid prescription; Absolute sobriety; No contact ACG; No contact with Mine Shaft in Hartford, WI

Defendant Paul Olivas III appeared by video.  Attorney Stephanie L Hanson in court for State of Wisconsin. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights. Def consents to video appearance. Not guilty plea entered by Court. Defendant eligible for State Public Defender. Court sets $1000 signature bond.
Hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
